intro: Calyptranthes latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and guava. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Calyptranthes latifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
